org.efaps.db.databases

Class DerbyDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.efaps.db.databases.AbstractDatabase<DerbyDatabase>
      • org.efaps.db.databases.DerbyDatabase

  • public class DerbyDatabase
extends AbstractDatabase<DerbyDatabase>
    The class implements Apache Derby specific methods for data base access.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    The eFaps Team

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected(Connection _connection)
        Method is used to determine if this DataBase is connected. It uses SQL statements against the database to determine if it is the right database using unique identifiers e.g. systemtables, version info etc.
        Specified by:
        isConnected in class AbstractDatabase<DerbyDatabase>
        Parameters:
        _connection - Connection to be used foo analyze
        Returns:
        true if this database is connected

      • deleteAll

        public void deleteAll(Connection _con)
               throws SQLException
        This is the Derby specific implementation of an all deletion. Following order is used to remove all eFaps specific information:
        • remove all foreign keys of the user
        • remove all views of the user
        • remove all tables of the user
        Attention! If application specific tables, views or constraints are defined, this database objects are also removed!
        Specified by:
        deleteAll in class AbstractDatabase<DerbyDatabase>
        Parameters:
        _con - sql connection
        Throws:
        SQLException - if remove of keys, views or tables failed

      • addTableColumn

        public DerbyDatabase addTableColumn(Connection _con,
                           String _tableName,
                           String _columnName,
                           AbstractDatabase.ColumnType _columnType,
                           String _defaultValue,
                           int _length,
                           int _scale)
                             throws SQLException
        Adds a column to a SQL table. The method overrides the original method, because Derby does not allow for NOT NULL columns that no default value is defined. Is such column is created, the default value for real and integer is 0, for date time, short and long string a zero length string.
        Overrides:
        addTableColumn in class AbstractDatabase<DerbyDatabase>
        Parameters:
        _con - SQL connection
        _tableName - name of table to update
        _columnName - column to add
        _columnType - type of column to add
        _defaultValue - default value of the column (or null if not specified)
        _length - length of column to add (or 0 if not specified)
        _scale - scale of the column to add (or 0 if not specified)
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        SQLException - if the column could not be added to the tables

      • supportsGetGeneratedKeys

        public boolean supportsGetGeneratedKeys()
        Description copied from class: AbstractDatabase
        The method returns if a database implementation supports to get generated keys while inserting a new line in a SQL table.
        Overrides:
        supportsGetGeneratedKeys in class AbstractDatabase<DerbyDatabase>
        Returns:
        always true because supported by Derby database

      • supportsBinaryInputStream

        public boolean supportsBinaryInputStream()
        Description copied from class: AbstractDatabase
        The method returns if a database implementation supports directly binary stream for result sets (instead of using first blobs).
        Overrides:
        supportsBinaryInputStream in class AbstractDatabase<DerbyDatabase>
        Returns:
        always true because supported by PostgreSQL database
        See Also:
        AbstractDatabase.supportsBlobInputStreamAvailable()

      • supportsBigTransactions

        public boolean supportsBigTransactions()
        Description copied from class: AbstractDatabase
        Returns true if a database could handle big transactions used within the eFaps updates.
        Overrides:
        supportsBigTransactions in class AbstractDatabase<DerbyDatabase>
        Returns:
        always false because Apache Derby has some problems to handle to big transactions

      • initTableInfoUniqueKeys

        protected void initTableInfoUniqueKeys(Connection _con,
                           String _sql,
                           Map<String,TableInformation> _cache4Name)
                                throws SQLException
        Fetches all unique keys for this table. Instead of using the JDBC meta data functionality, a SQL statement on system tables are used, because the JDBC meta data functionality returns for unique keys internal names and not the real names. Also if a unique key includes also columns with null values, this unique keys are not included.
        Overrides:
        initTableInfoUniqueKeys in class AbstractDatabase<DerbyDatabase>
        Parameters:
        _con - Connection
        _sql - Statement
        _cache4Name - cache
        Throws:
        SQLException - if unique keys could not be fetched
